review.title: Sukiyaki in French style: A novel system for transformation of dietary patterns
review.abstract: We propose a novel system which can transform a recipe into any selected regional style (e.g., Japanese, Mediterranean, or Italian). This system has three characteristics. First the system can identify the degree of dietary style mixture of any selected recipe. Second, the system can visualize such dietary style mixtures using barycentric Newton diagrams. Third, the system can suggest ingredient substitutions through an extended word2vec model, such that a recipe becomes more authentic for any selected dietary style. Drawing on a large number of recipes from Yummly, an example shows how the proposed system can transform a traditional Japanese recipe, Sukiyaki, into French style.

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: Modern dietary styles are more prone to unhealthy eating patterns [1]. Therefore, there is an emerging consensus that public health efforts should focus on developing innovative technology to change dietary habits in order to become healthier. While there is compelling research in nutritional sciences on what makes a recipe healthy [2], this does not necessarily mean that such a recipe is tailored to one's own dietary preferences. Furthermore, the Japanese dietary style as measured in the 1970s is considered healthy [3]. Recipes in such a Japanese style are not limited to such a public health perspective for those who prefer a South American dietary style, with a growing variety of personal dietary preferences and dietary styles, personalized information systems that can turn a recipe into a selected dietary style that a user might prefer would help food companies and professional chefs create new recipes.

sections.heading: 2 Architecture of recommendation system
sections.text: Figure 1 shows the overall architecture of the recommendation system, which consists of two steps: 1) identification and visualization of the dietary style mix of a recipe; and 2) algorithm that transforms a particular recipe into a selected regional / rural style. Details of the steps are described as follows.

sections.heading: 2.1 Step 1: Identification and visualization of a recipe’s dietary style mixture
sections.text: The neural network model was constructed as shown in Figure 2.When we enter a recipe, this model classifies which country or which regional cuisine the recipe belongs to. Input is a vector with the dimension of the total number of ingredients contained in the data set, and only the indices of the ingredients contained in the input recipe are 1, otherwise they are 0.There are two hidden layers. Therefore, this model can consider a combination of ingredients to predict the probability of the country. Also, for the hidden layer, dropout is used by randomly (20%) setting the value of the node to 0. Thus, a robust network is constructed. In this study, the dimension of the last layer is the number of countries, here 20 countries.
